com.matrixone.apps.domain.util
Class mxBus

java.lang.Object
  com.matrixone.apps.domain.util.mxBus

public class mxBus
extends java.lang.Object

The mxBus class provides tools for the Java developer to easily manipulate and retrieve information about BusinessObjects. This class consists exclusively of static methods. Many of the methods accept BusinessObjects as parameters. If the BusinessObject is open when it is passed to the method then it will remain open when the method returns. If the BusinessObject is closed when it is passed to the method then it will be opened and closed within the scope of the method.

Version:
1.0 - Copyright (c) 2001, MatrixOne, Inc.
See Also:
matrix.db.BusinessObject

Method Detail

change

public static void change(Context context,
                          java.lang.Object busId,
                          java.lang.String busType,
                          java.lang.String busName,
                          java.lang.String busRevision,
                          java.lang.String busVault,
                          java.lang.String busPolicy)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Change Business Object Basic Information.

Example:
 BusinessObject boTest = new BusinessObject("Project", "Test",
                                            "1", "eService Sample");
 mxBus.change(context, boTest, "Location", "Location", "-",
              "eService Administration", "Location");

Parameters:
context - The matrix context object.
busId - The BusinessObject to copy - may be a BusinessObject or a String id.
busType - The New BusinessObject Type - Not changed when null.
busName - The New BusinessObject Name - Not changed when null.
busRevision - The New BusinessObject Revision - Not changed when null.
busVault - The New BusinessObject Vault - Not changed when null.
busPolicy - The New BusinessObject Policy - Not changed when null.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If create fails due to a Matrix error.

copy

public static BusinessObject copy(Context context,
                                  java.lang.Object busId,
                                  java.lang.String busName,
                                  java.lang.String busRevision,
                                  java.lang.String busVault)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
Copies an existing business object.

Example:
 BusinessObject boTest = new BusinessObject("Project", "Test",
                                            "1", "eService Sample");
 BusinessObject cEmp = mxBus.copy(context, boTest, "Copied Project",
                                  "-", "eService Sample");

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
busId - The BusinessObject to copy - may be a BusinessObject or a String id.
busName - The New BusinessObject Name - required.
busRevision - The New BusinessObject Revision - first sequence used when null.
busVault - The New BusinessObject Vault - context vault used when null.
Returns:
BusinessObject The newly cloned business object.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If create fails due to a Matrix error.

busRevision - The BusinessObject Revision - first sequence used when null.
busPolicy - The BusinessObject Policy - first available policy used when null.
busVault - The BusinessObject Vault - context vault used when null.
Returns:
BusinessObject The newly created business object.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If create fails due to a Matrix error.

expand

public static MapList expand(Context context,
                             java.lang.Object busId,
                             java.lang.String relPattern,
                             java.lang.String typePattern,
                             boolean getTo,
                             boolean getFrom,
                             int recursionLevel,
                             StringList busSelects,
                             StringList relSelects,
                             java.lang.String busWhereClause,
                             java.lang.String relWhereClause,
                             java.lang.String postRelPattern,
                             java.lang.String postTypePattern)
                      throws FrameworkException
Expands the given object into a map list containing a list of mappings from selectable names to values. The relationship selects are prefixed with "rel-" to keep them separate. Also, a "level" key is added to each map to define the level of the expand.

Example:
 BusinessObject boExpand = new BusinessObject("Company", "Company Name",
                                        "-", "eService Administration");
 StringList busSelect = new StringList();
 busSelect.addElement("name");
 MapList ml = mxBus.expand(context, boExpand, "Employee",
                      "Person", false, true, 1, busSelect, null,
                      "name ~= '*ECR*' && current==Active &&
                      attribute[Host Meetings]=='Yes'",
                      null, null, null);

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
busId - The BusinessObject to expand - may be a BusinessObject or a String id.
relPattern - The relationship pattern to expand along.
typePattern - The type pattern to expand along.
getTo - Define whether the expand should go in the "to" dir.
getFrom - Define whether the expand should go in the "from" dir.
recursionLevel - The number of levels to expand - 0 for all
busSelects - the eMatrix StringList object that holds the list of expand select clause - may be null or empty.
relSelects - the eMatrix StringList object that holds the list of expand select clause - may be null or empty.
busWhereClause - The where clause on the business object selectables - may be null or empty
relWhereClause - The where clause on the relationship object selectables - may be null or empty
postRelPattern - The relationships to include following the expand. This may be be empty, null or a comma separated list.
postTypePattern - The types to include following the expand. This may be be empty, null or a comma separated list.
Returns:
The list containing selectable name to value maps.
Throws:
FrameworkException - java.util.Exception If the expansion causes an error.

expand

public static MapList expand(Context context,
                             java.lang.Object busId,
                             java.lang.String relPattern,
                             java.lang.String typePattern,
                             boolean getTo,
                             boolean getFrom,
                             int recursionLevel,
                             StringList busSelects,
                             StringList relSelects,
                             java.lang.String busWhereClause,
                             java.lang.String relWhereClause,
                             java.lang.String postRelPattern,
                             java.lang.String postTypePattern,
                             java.util.Map postPatterns)
                      throws FrameworkException
Expands the given object into a map list containing a list of mappings from selectable names to values. The relationship selects are prefixed with "rel-" to keep them separate. Also, a "level" key is added to each map to define the level of the expand.

Example:
 BusinessObject boExpand = new BusinessObject("Company", "Company Name",
                                        "-", "eService Administration");
 StringList busSelect = new StringList();
 busSelect.addElement("name");
 MapList ml = mxBus.expand(context, boExpand, "Employee",
                      "Person", false, true, 1, busSelect, null,
                      "name ~= '*ECR*' && current==Active &&
                      attribute[Host Meetings]=='Yes'",
                      null, null, null, null);

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
busId - The BusinessObject to expand - may be a BusinessObject or a String id.
relPattern - The relationship pattern to expand along.
typePattern - The type pattern to expand along.
getTo - Define whether the expand should go in the "to" dir.
getFrom - Define whether the expand should go in the "from" dir.
recursionLevel - The number of levels to expand - 0 for all
busSelects - the eMatrix StringList object that holds the list of expand select clause - may be null or empty.
relSelects - the eMatrix StringList object that holds the list of expand select clause - may be null or empty.
busWhereClause - The where clause on the business object selectables - may be null or empty
relWhereClause - The where clause on the relationship object selectables - may be null or empty
postRelPattern - The relationships to include following the expand. This may be be empty, null or a comma separated list.
postTypePattern - The types to include following the expand. This may be be empty, null or a comma separated list.
postPatterns - The patterns to include following the expand This may be be null. Each key should match a selectable. Each map value is the pattern to match against the result set (may be comma separated).
Returns:
The list containing selectable name to value maps.
Throws:
FrameworkException - If the expansion causes an error.

getAttribute

public static Attribute getAttribute(Context context,
                                     java.lang.Object busId,
                                     java.lang.String name)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
Returns the business object's attribute object corresponding to the given attribute name.

Example:
 BusinessObject boTest = new BusinessObject("Project", "Test",
                                            "1", "eService Sample");
 Attribute attr = mxBus.getAttribute(context, boTest,
                                     "Project Visibility");

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
busId - The BusinessObject to retireve attribute information - may be a BusinessObject or a String id.
name - the name of the attribute to return.
Returns:
an Attribute object that represents the business object's attribute of the given name.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If the attribute can not be retrieved due to a Matrix error.
See Also:
matrix.db.Attribute

getAttributeDetails

public static java.util.Map getAttributeDetails(Context context,
                                                java.lang.Object boOrId)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
Returns all the business object's attribute details in a Map of Maps.

Example:
 BusinessObject boTest = new BusinessObject("Project", "Test",
                                            "1", "eService Sample");
 Map attrdId = mxBus.getAttributeDetails(context, boTest);

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
boOrId - the BusinessObject or an id of a Business Object to get the attribute details from.
Returns:
a Map that maps attribute names to a Map of the attribute details. The attribute details Map contains the following keys: SEL_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE, SEL_ATTRIBUTE_NAME, SEL_ATTRIBUTE_CHOICES, SEL_ATTRIBUTE_MULTILINE, SEL_ATTRIBUTE_VALUE; e.g. map.get(mxBus.SEL_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE);
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If the attribute can not be retrieved due to a Matrix error.
See Also:
Map

getBasics

public static java.lang.String[] getBasics(Context context,
                                           java.lang.Object busId,
                                           java.lang.String[] names)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
Returns basic information from the business object. The basic information to be returned is passed to the method in the form of an array of Strings.

Example:
 BusinessObject boTest = new BusinessObject("Project", "Test",
                                            "1", "eService Sample");
 String[] bNames = new String[] {"modified","policy", "locked", "owner"};
 String[] basic = mxBus.getBasics(context, boTest, bNames);

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
busId - The BusinessObject to get basics for - may be a BusinessObject or a String id.
names - an array of Strings containing the names of the basic data to be returned.
Returns:
an array of Strings containing the values of the selected basic data.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If the basic can not be retrieved due to a Matrix error.

The BusinessObject class variable.

java.lang.Exception - If the operation fails.

gotoTargetState

public static void gotoTargetState(Context context,
                                   java.lang.Object busId,
                                   java.lang.String targetState)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
Promote or demote the businessobject to the target state. If the BusinessObject is currently in a state before the target state the BusinessObject will be promoted. If the BusinessObject is currently in a state that is after the target state then the BusinessObject will be demoted. If the BusinessObject is in the target state then there will be no DB transaction.

Example:
 BusinessObject boTest = new BusinessObject("Project", "Test",
                                            "1", "eService Sample");
 mxBus.gotoTargetState(context, boTest, "Assign");

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
busId - The BusinessObject to set the state against - may be a BusinessObject or a String id.
targetState - The name of the target state.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the state is not found in the policy governing the BusinessObject, or the promote or the demote operation fails due to a Matrix error.

gotoTargetState

public static void gotoTargetState(Context context,
                                   java.lang.Object busId,
                                   java.lang.String targetState,
                                   java.lang.String className)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
Promote or demote the businessobject to the target state. If the BusinessObject is currently in a state before the target state the BusinessObject will be promoted. If the BusinessObject is currently in a state that is after the target state then the BusinessObject will be demoted. If the BusinessObject is in the target state then there will be no DB transaction.

Example:
 BusinessObject boTest = new BusinessObject("Project", "Test",
                                            "1", "eService Sample");
 mxBus.gotoTargetState(context, boTest, "Assign");

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
busId - The BusinessObject to set the state against - may be a BusinessObject or a String id.
targetState - The name of the target state.
className - The name of the class to use when instantiating the business object - may be null. If this is null, then the BusinessObject class will be used.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the state is not found in the policy governing the BusinessObject, or the promote or the demote operation fails due to a Matrix error.

print

public static java.util.Map print(Context context,
                                  java.lang.Object busId,
                                  StringList busSelects,
                                  java.util.Collection multiValueList)
                           throws FrameworkException
Gets the selectables from a given business object.

Example:
 BusinessObject boTest = new BusinessObject("Project", "Test",
                                            "1", "eService Sample");
 StringList slSelectables = new StringList();
 slSelectables.addElement("id");
 slSelectables.addElement("current");
 slSelectables.addElement("vault");
 Map sResults = mxBus.print(context, boTest, slSelectables, null);

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
busId - The BusinessObject to retrieve data against - may be a BusinessObject or a String id.
busSelects - The selectables of a business object to retrieve.
multiValueList - The selectables that may contain multiple values - may be null.
Returns:
The selectables names and values in a form of a map - the values for the map may be a String or List depending on the selectable. By default, every selectable will be a single String value unless specified.
Throws:
FrameworkException - If operation fails.
See Also:
matrix.db.BusinessObject

revise

public static BusinessObject revise(Context context,
                                    java.lang.Object busId,
                                    java.lang.String busRevision,
                                    java.lang.String busVault)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
Copies an existing business object.

Example:
 BusinessObject boTest = new BusinessObject("Project", "Test",
                                            "1", "eService Sample");
 BusinessObject boRevised = mxBus.revise(context, boTest, "2",
                                         "eService Administration");

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
busId - The BusinessObject to copy - may be a BusinessObject or a String id.
busRevision - The New BusinessObject Revision - next in sequence used when null.
busVault - The New BusinessObject Vault - source business object vault used when null.
Returns:
BusinessObject The newly revised business object.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If create fails due to a Matrix error.

setAttributeValues

public static void setAttributeValues(Context context,
                                      java.lang.Object busId,
                                      java.util.Map attributeMap)
                               throws FrameworkException
Modify the attibutes on a businessobject. If the business object is open when passed to the method, then it will remain open. If the business object passed is closed, then it will be opened and closed by the method.

Example:
 BusinessObject boAttr = new BusinessObject("Person", "Test Buyer",
                                             "-", "eService Sample");
 HashMap map = new HashMap();
 map.put("Email Address", "abc@abc.com");
 map.put("Work Phone Number", "1234567");
 mxBus.setAttributeValues(context, boAttr, map);

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
busId - The business object id to modify - can be a Business Object or a String id.
attributeMap - A map representation of attributes and attribute values. It is defined as:
key = (String) attribute name
value = (String) attribute value
Throws:
FrameworkException - if request fails.
See Also:
getAttributeValues(Context, java.lang.Object)

setAttributeValue

public static void setAttributeValue(Context context,
                                     java.lang.Object busId,
                                     java.lang.String name,
                                     java.lang.String value)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
Sets the attribute value of a specific attribute on the business object.

Example:
 BusinessObject boAttr = new BusinessObject("Person", "Test Buyer",
                                             "-", "eService Sample");
 mxBus.setAttributeValue(context, boAttr, "Work Phone Number", "7777777");

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
busId - The BusinessObject to modify - may be a BusinessObject or a String id.
name - the name of the attribute to modify.
value - the value to place in the attribute.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the attribute value can not be set due to a Matrix error.
See Also:
matrix.db.Attribute, getAttributeValue(Context, java.lang.Object, java.lang.String)

setDescription

public static void setDescription(Context context,
                                  java.lang.Object busId,
                                  java.lang.String busDescription)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
Sets the description value of a business object.

Example:
 BusinessObject boTest = new BusinessObject("Project", "Test",
                                            "1", "eService Sample");
 mxBus.setDescription(context, boTest, "This is a test description.");

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
busId - The BusinessObject to modify - may be a BusinessObject or a String id.
busDescription - The new description for the business object.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the attribute value can not be set due to a Matrix error.

setOwner

public static void setOwner(Context context,
                            java.lang.Object busId,
                            java.lang.String busOwner)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
Sets the owner of a business object.

Example:
 BusinessObject boTest = new BusinessObject("Project", "Test",
                                            "1", "eService Sample");
 mxBus.setOwner(context, boTest, "Test Employee");

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
busId - The BusinessObject to modify - may be a BusinessObject or a String id.
busOwner - The new owner for the business object - must be a valid Matrix User.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the attribute value can not be set due to a Matrix error.

unlock

public static void unlock(Context context,
                          java.lang.Object busId)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Unlock an existing business object.

Example:
 BusinessObject boUnlock = new BusinessObject("Person", "Test Buyer",
                                              "-", "eService Sample");
 mxBus.unlock(context, boUnlock);

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
busId - The BusinessObject to modify - may be a BusinessObject or a String id.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the attribute value can not be set due to a Matrix error.
